page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY-WELL (cont.)
page.content: The well in{1984}was very rusty, it could hardly be seen against the stone background. Star pupils decided to save the well and restore it. With the help of the waterboard and, in particular{Mr.Bert Wheellan}, the well was lifted out of the ground. We were surprised to see that the part of the well that had been underground was the same length as the part above the ground,namely 1 metre, therefore the total height of the well was 2 metres. Mr. Wheellan started to clean the well at Carrieston Reservoir with a wire brush and we went up to help one afternoon. Mr.Wheellan spray painted the well with grey undercoat, then it was painted black, apart from the lion's face which was painted gold. A hole was dug next to the school door in the school playground by Mr. Wheellan and some of the parents
